comments.raw_text: Time the profile manager is open is counted in startup time, and we don't want that. See bug 670194 comments 22-26.
comments.text: Time the profile manager is open is counted in startup time, and we don't want that. See bug 670194 comments 22-26.
comments.author: margaret.leibovic@gmail.com
comments.creator: margaret.leibovic@gmail.com

comments.text: Don't we measure startup from the process start time? The profile manager launches a new process, so I don't think it should be affected.
comments.raw_text: Don't we measure startup from the process start time? The profile manager launches a new process, so I don't think it should be affected.
comments.author: benjamin@smedbergs.us
comments.creator: benjamin@smedbergs.us

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Benjamin Smedberg  [:bsmedberg] from comment #1)
> Don't we measure startup from the process start time? The profile manager
> launches a new process, so I don't think it should be affected.

exec()ing a process replaces existing process(ie keeps pid, etc).

comments.creator: djcater+bugzilla@gmail.com
comments.text:
(In reply to Benjamin Smedberg  [:bsmedberg] from comment #1)
> Don't we measure startup from the process start time? The profile manager
> launches a new process, so I don't think it should be affected.

Benjamin, see bug 670194 comment 26 which Margaret referred to in comment 0. It's a quick test that removes the need for speculation. I have Telemetry reporting enabled but all my startup data that are reported are bogus due to this bug, as I'm sure is true for most Nightly users.
comments.author: djcater+bugzilla@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: ok. This is Linux-only then, since every other platform actually launches a new process and doesen't just exec().
